body.p: The undersigned, your petitioners state that John O'Brien was indicted in the Scott Circuit Court for unlawfully selling liquor; nor found guilty at the August term and fined $60 in default of payment of which he was sent to jail and is now in confinement.

The facts of the case, as the undersigned are informed, are briefly these: O'Brien was at work on a turnpike road, and a friend of his applied to him to sell him a quart of whiskey. He refused to sell, but gave the man the liquor. Sometime afterward the man insisted on paying for it and threw down a dime and left. This was the whole offense. He is a poor man with a family of small children who depend upon his daily labor for support, and who would actually suffer for want of the necessaries of life, if his confinement is continued.
It is therefore hoped that as much of the punishment as is within the power of the execution be remitted
